title: Overall
stimulusHtml:
9-8-7-6 points: Stronger

AN ESSAY IN THIS CATEGORY WILL ILLUSTRATE THE FOLLOWING QUALITIES WITH VARYING DEGREES OF EFFECTIVENESS:

  1. Has a clear, well-developed thesis - need not be at the beginning.

  2. Is well organized.

  3. Competently addresses the terms of the question in the areas of tasks (compare and contrast), content (great powers and Poland), and chronology:

    1. compares the 1772-1815 and 1918-1939 relationships of the powers of Poland, and

    2. contrasts the 1772-1815 and 1918-1939 relationships of the great powers to Poland

      • clearly, fully, evenly, and explicitly: 8-9

      • less clearly and perhaps implicitly: 6-7

  4. Supports the thesis with specific evidence (probably more than one event per era)

    • fully and evenly: 8-9

    • implicitly: 6-7

  5. May contain minor errors, or a single major error; even a "9" need not be flawless.

5-4 points: Mixed

THESE SCORES SHOULD BE ASSIGNED JUDICIOUSLY.

  1. Contains a thesis, perhaps superficial or simplistic.

  2. Responds to the terms of the question unevenly in the areas of tasks, content, and chronology (might stress post-1939):

    1. compares and/or contrasts minimally: a recitation of facts with little application to the tasks, and

    2. has significant imbalance of the two eras.

  3. Contains evidence that is broad and general in nature (maybe only one event per era).

  4. May contain errors, factual and/or interpretive.

3-2-1-0 points: Weaker

AN ESSAY IN THIS CATEGORY WILL DEMONSTRATE THE FOLLOWING QUALITIES TO VARYING DEGREES. ESSAYS SCORED 0 OR 1 MAY ATTEMPT TO ADDRESS THE QUESTION, BUT FAIL TO DO SO.

  1. Has a thesis that is

    • confused and unfocused: 2-3

    • absent, or simply restates the question: 0-1

  2. Misconstrues the question, or omits major tasks:

    1. refers only to 1772-1815, OR only to 1918-1939, OR only post-1939 for modem era, and

    2. compares only or contrasts only (with no implicit nod to other task).

  3. Contains evidence that is

    • weak: 2-3

    • non-existent: 0-1

  4. Contains major errors.

— Non-responsive

Off-task, absent, or irrelevant answer.
